page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Herefords, and Long-horns. Some beef-cattle are bred, Friesian x Charollais. Some sheep are reared for meat, some birds (pheasants) for game or eating, goats for milk and meat, horses for riding, dogs, cats and small animals for pets. The main crops grown are kale and hay for cattle, wheat, oats, barley, potatoes, mangolds, turf for lawns, and rape for seed merchants. In spring the patchwork of fields includes beautiful patches of yellow made by the flowers of the rape. There is some market-gardening on a small scale, and people travel seven miles from Derby to buy raspberries, strawberries, salad vegetables and other vegetables __ carrots, cabbage, cauliflowers, peas, beans and onions. Several people sell free-range eggs, and others keep bees and sell locally-
